thread.title: 5 things to know Friday: Scarlet Knights gearing up for 'blackout' affair
thread.title_full: 5 Rutgers things to know Friday: Scarlet Knights gearing up for 'blackout' affair | NJ.com

author: Keith Sargeant | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: 5 things to know Friday: Scarlet Knights gearing up for 'blackout' affair
text:
There's something that brings out the best in the Rutgers football team whenever it sheds its traditional jerseys in favor of the black uniforms.
For the seventh time in modern history, the Scarlet Knights (2-2) will wear their black jerseys Saturday night when they host No. 4 Michigan State (5-0) in a primetime affair at High Point Solutions Stadium.
Kickoff is slated for 8 p.m., and the game will air on BTN.
The Scarlet Knights will be wearing their all-black attire, and the school is asking the fans to do the same.
Rutgers has traditionally had success wearing black, winning four of its six "blackout'' affairs. The Scarlet Knights defeated Pitt (in 2011), UConn (2012), Arkansas (2013) and Michigan (2014) and lost to West Virginia (2007) and Louisville (2012) while wearing the black jerseys.
Last year, the Scarlet Knights thrived off an electric "blackout'' atmosphere to roll past Michigan, 26-24, for its first-ever Big Ten triumph before 53,327 fans.
"I think it'll be on the par with the last two, especially the blackout from last year,'' Rutgers interim head coach Norries Wilson said Thursday when asked about his anticipation for the Michigan State atmosphere."I expect our fans will come in and make it hard for Michigan State on offense, and to cheer for our team, and give us great energy.''
Blackout! #RFootball vs. Michigan State - Oct. 10 #BlackoutTheBirthplace http://t.co/Brvx5rCUKY
